Please note: This option has security implications, only use with trusted OpenID Connect providers.
If disabled, authentication will fail for accounts with existing email addresses, users may connect existing accounts on their personal Connected Accounts page in a secure way.
A pluggable client implementation for the OpenID Connect protocol.

A pluggable client implementation for the OpenID Connect protocol. You can enable available OpenID Connect clients within the OpenID Connect settings page. For more information, see the online documentation for the OpenID Connect module.

Drupal users can use external OpenID Connect authentication providers to register and login to the Drupal site.
During login and user registration user attributes can optionally be synchronized with the OpenID Connect claims mapping.
Easily add an own provider by using the provided Generic client, or use a custom provider client plugin.
Failed to get authentication tokens for @provider. Check logs for further details.
If disabled, user claims will only be saved when the account is first created.
If enabled, a user will be registered even if registration is set to "Administrators only".
If enabled, user creation will always be allowed, even if the registration setting is set to require admin approval, or only allowing admins to create users.
If the account is connected with an external provider, the user needs this permission in order to set their own password.
